subject: Art & Design
title: History of Photography: From Camera Obscura to Digital
description: A short lesson to help you apply History of Photography: From Camera Obscura to Digital.

hook.text: The first photograph ever taken (1826) required an 8-hour exposure. Today your phone shoots 60 frames per second.

buildup.text: The camera obscura (dark room) projected images through a pinhole for centuries.

discovery.text: Daguerreotype (1839), film rolls (1888), Polaroid (1948), digital sensors (1975) .

twist.text: Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975, then buried it to protect film sales. They went bankrupt in 2012.

climax.text: Today, 1.4 trillion photos are taken annually. More images were created in the last 2 years than in all prior history.

punchline.text: Photography went from 8-hour exposures to 8 billion photographers in under 200.

quiz.question: Why did Kodak fail despite inventing the digital camera?
options: They buried the technology to protect their profitable film business
Digital cameras were too expensive to manufacture
Consumers preferred film over digital quality
